column4: My laptop has the Intel 945GM chipset, but the integrated sound does not work (it's a laptop). The driver is loaded and whatnot, and I'm pretty sure it's not muted. What else could be wrong?
(Yay, I managed to mention it's a laptop twice >_>)
you have checked the system volume control by double clicking the speaker icon next to the clock?
Yeap, nothing is muted.
is your soundcard listed under Device Manager?
Where is the Device Manager hiding?
System > Prefrences
Ah right, it is, yeah.
is your laptop a dell Latitude?
Nope, Toshiba Satellite
what are you using to try and play audio?
I've tried Rhythmbox for my music, but none of the system sounds work either.
Also, even low-level tests like noise don't work.
what is listed for your audio device when you type 'lspci' in the terminal?
00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801G (ICH7 Family) High Definition Audio Controller (rev 02)
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.20/+bug/92825
you'running 6.06 then?
Nope, 7.04
did that link help? there woro some suggestions in the comments
Yeah, I'm trying something now.
Re my sound prob, I had to add "options snd-hda-intel model=3stack" to /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base. It doesn't work through the headphones though.
man... that is a weird issue ya got
Aha, I simply had to check the "headphone" box in the volume control and all is working.
I sure can. Thanks for the link.
